content.question: In an experiment, students use a force sensor to apply a force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> to an object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> that is initially at rest. The force is exerted in the <math alttext="positive x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mo>+</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-direction for a time <math alttext="lowercase t equals uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. The impulse exerted on the device is <math alttext="J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. Which of following procedure changes would result in an impulse <math alttext="2 J" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>J</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> being exerted on an object?

choices.label: Exert a force of magnitude <math alttext="the fraction F over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> on an object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for a time <math alttext="lowercase t equals uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Exert a force of magnitude <math alttext="the fraction F over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math> on an object of mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for a time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 2 uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Exert a force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on an object of mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for a time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 2 uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Exert a force of magnitude <math alttext="2 F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on an object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for a time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 2 uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

Exert a force of magnitude <math alttext="2 F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on an object of mass <math alttext="m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for a time <math alttext="lowercase t equals the fraction, uppercase T over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mfrac><mrow><mi>T</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: Exert a force of magnitude <math alttext="F" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>F</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> on an object of mass <math alttext="2 m" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>m</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> for a time <math alttext="lowercase t equals 2 uppercase T" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>T</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>.

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
